      • format

        @PublishedMethod
public java.lang.String format(java.lang.String message,
                                                 java.lang.Object... arguments)
        Formats the passed message by replacing the placeholders, with the passed arguments in {index} style. See IMixedTextBuilder.appendFormat(String, Object...) for more details.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to format
        arguments - the arguments.
        Returns:
        the string

      • formatDebug

        @PublishedMethod
public java.lang.String formatDebug(java.lang.String message,
                                                      java.lang.Object... arguments)
        Formats the passed message with the passed arguments, like an IMixedText.

        The used context in DEBUG, so the passed arguments are expanded with debug information. You should not display the returned string to an end user. Please use ILoggerMessageFormatter.formatEndUser(String, Object...) instead.

        Specified by:
        formatDebug in interface ILoggerMessageFormatter
        Parameters:
        message - the message
        arguments - the arguments
        Returns:
        the formatted string

      • formatEndUser

        @PublishedMethod
public java.lang.String formatEndUser(java.lang.String message,
                                                        java.lang.Object... arguments)
        Formats the passed message with the passed arguments, like an IMixedText.

        The used context in USER, so the passed arguments are expanded without any debug information. You should display the returned string to an end user, instead of ILoggerMessageFormatter.formatDebug(String, Object...).

        Specified by:
        formatEndUser in interface ILoggerMessageFormatter
        Parameters:
        message - the message
        arguments - the arguments
        Returns:
        the formatted string

      • formatObject

        @PublishedMethod
public java.lang.String formatObject(java.lang.Object obj)
        Formats an object by an IFormatter, if any formatter was registered for this element.

        If no formatter is present .toString() is called

        Parameters:
        obj - the obj
        Returns:
        the string
